name: filter-frame-stream
description: Filter data frames from a stream of buffers by a head marker and optional tail—or trailing—marker, keeping these bytes intact in the returned chunks. This is useful when splitting up a stream of data with embedded frames used by some protocols (especially useful for variable length frame protocols), or even for extracting other data, such as JPEG images.
author: Akiva Levy <akiva@sixthirteen.co> (http://sixthirteen.co/)
